items.title: Apple suspends Parler from App Store
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.description: Apple confirmed that it has suspended the conservative social media app Parler from the App Store, shortly after Google banned it from Google Play. The app, which became a home to Trump supporters and several high-profile conservatives in the days leading up to the Capitol riots, had been operating …

items.title: Google Bans Parler, Apple and Amazon Suspend it
items.author: Mashable
items.description: What is Parler and who is using it? Does the app "censor" users? How is it different from Facebook, Twitter, and Reddit? Here's our explainer.

items.title: 'Hang Mike Pence': Twitter stops phrase trending after Capitol riot
items.author: Martin Pengelly in New York
items.description:
Twitter stopped the phrase “Hang Mike Pence” trending on Saturday, but not before it trended on the social media platform in the aftermath of the company’s decision to suspend Donald Trump’s account.
The chant was heard in the US Capitol on Wednesday, as a mob incited by the president mounted a …
items.content:

items.title: Deplatforming the Pro-Trump Web
items.author: Tech
items.description: In the aftermath of the siege on the U.S. Capitol by a pro-Trump mob, tech companies are taking steps to reduce the chances of having their platforms be used by the president and others to instigate violence. Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Twitch, Shopify, Apple, Google and others have announced that they've either banned Donald Trump outright or accounts belonging to his allies and supporters.
items.content: In the aftermath of the siege on the U.S. Capitol by a pro-Trump mob, tech companies are taking steps to reduce the chances of having their platforms be used by the president and others to instigate violence. Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Twitch, Shopify, Apple, Google and others have announced that they've either banned Donald Trump outright or accounts belonging to his allies and supporters.

items.title: Here's why everyone should own a cheap Android tablet
items.author: C. Scott Brown
items.description: In my house, one of the screens I touch the most is what I call my kitchen tablet. It’s a Samsung Galaxy Tab A7 that sits on a stand on my kitchen counter. I use it for accessing recipes in my OneDrive storage, watching how-to videos on YouTube, browsing the web looking for new recipes, and simple …

items.title: Gab gaining 10,000 users per hour, CEO claims, after Trump's permanent Twitter suspension
items.author: Brie Stimson
items.description:
Gab, a more conservative-friendly alternative social media platform to Twitter, claimed Saturday it is gaining 10,000 users an hour in the wake of Twitter permanently suspending President Trump’s account.
Trump has also been blocked from posting on Facebook and Instagram -- at least until his term …

items.title: The online far right is angry, exultant, and ready for more
items.author: Jerusalem Demsas
items.description:
In the wake of pro-Trump extremists invading the Capitol, the online right displayed fault lines as it publicly processed the events of the past week.
Clear arguments and ideas are gaining traction and some have even been repeated by members of Congress. On Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, the message …

items.title: WhatsApp Uses Urged To Switch To Signal, Skype Following Controversial Privacy Update
items.author: Carly Page
items.description:
WhatsApp users are being urged to switch to Signal and Skype after it recently notified users that they would have to share their data with Facebook.
The Facebook-owned messaging service has received a lot of criticism after telling its 2 billion+ users that they must agree to share their data with …
